hero.subtitle: Bridging clinical medicine and machine intelligence to build healthcare AI systems that clinicians can trust.

educationLines: B.S. Data Science, Minor in Business
paragraphs: I am a junior at the University of Michigan, pursuing a major in Data Science with a minor in Business, on a premedical track. My work sits at the intersection of clinical medicine and machine intelligence - I believe the most meaningful advances in healthcare will come from people who understand both the data and the patient.

My research centers on large language models for clinical applications, computer-aided detection in medical imaging, and the design of AI systems that clinicians can actually trust. I have contributed to publications in JAMA and the Journal of Bone and Joint Surgery.

Outside of research, I lead educational initiatives as VP of Education at the Michigan Data Science Team and direct technology strategy at Blueprints for Pangaea. When I am away from my laptop, you will find me perfecting my ramen broth, engineering smashburgers, or reverse-searing a steak.
about.quote: The most meaningful advances in healthcare will come from people who understand both the data and the patient.

experience.description: Applied machine learning to clinical and operational datasets within one of the nation's largest Catholic health systems.
Contributing to computer-aided detection and AI research under the Department of Radiology, developing models for medical imaging analysis.
Built LLM-powered pipelines for systematic review automation, culminating in publications in JAMA and JBJS.
Developed web scraping tools and data infrastructure to support population health engagement strategies.

leadership.description: Lead educational programming for one of the largest student data science organizations in the country.
Directed data strategy and technology initiatives for a nonprofit focused on medical device redistribution.

contact.heading: Let's Build Something Together
contact.subtitle: Whether you have a research collaboration in mind, a data problem to solve, or just want to talk about healthcare AI - my inbox is always open.
